subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A female voice / RS Hack revisited
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Thanks Bruce, I will try the 469 next week if I don't get my hands on  
the older model. I was wondering if I'd get used to the clicking, we  
humans are so good at adapting. Good idea also with talking with the  
local RS manager. I'm also going to be in Florida this weekend and  
will scope out the RS stores between Orlando and St Augustine.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Debbie Tejada

"Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert  
Einstein

On Jan 3, 2008, at 8:29 AM, bhali333 wrote:

>
> Deb,
>
> The new model 469's have the inherent clicking after using it for a
> while you will learn to ignore it. Juli Velazquez has both 469 and
> old model 470 and she prefers the 469 and gets very good results with
> it.
>
> My suggestion is make your local radio shack manager aware that you
> are searching for these particular radios and can he please try to
> locate one for you. I'm sure that there is one or two sitting on a
> shelf in some radio shack somewhere.
>
> If you can get an older model 469 that does not have the clicking, It
> looks exactly like the older model 470 and comes in the cardboard box
> nox the plastic see through rapper.
>
> hang in there something will turn up. And if not don't let that
> discourage you from your research just do your best and what you have
> will work for you.
>
> bruce
>
>
>
